node.statement: VERIFICATION OF PARTIAL FRACTION IDENTITY: The identity sum_{j!=i} 1/(lambda_i - lambda_j) = (1/2) sum_k 1/(lambda_i - gamma_k) can be verified independently. Consider (d/dx) log r(x) = r'(x)/r(x) = sum_{i=1}^n 1/(x - lambda_i). Differentiating: r''(x)/r(x) - (r'(x)/r(x))^2 = -sum_i 1/(x - lambda_i)^2. At x approaching lambda_i, the dominant terms give: r''(lambda_i)/r'(lambda_i) = 2 * sum_{j!=i} 1/(lambda_i - lambda_j) (via L'Hopital or Laurent expansion). This confirms H_r(lambda_i) = r''(lambda_i)/(2r'(lambda_i)) = sum_{j!=i} 1/(lambda_i - lambda_j), which combined with Step 1.4.4 yields the identity. QED for the KEY LEMMA.
